modules.description: Extracts the HTTP method, request body, and target path from an HTTP request. Retrieves specific headers by name. Operates on an opaque request type representing an HTTP request structure. Used to process incoming HTTP traffic and extract actionable data for routing or logging.

Creates and configures an HTTP response with a status code, headers, and body. Operates on an internal `http_response` type to build structured HTTP replies. Used to construct dynamic server responses in web applications.

Handles HTTP request parsing, response generation, and server initialization using non-blocking I/O. Operates on raw byte streams, HTTP headers, and JSON data structures. Used to build lightweight, high-performance web services with minimal overhead.

Processes HTTP requests by extracting method, path, body, and headers from an opaque request type, enabling routing and logging. Constructs HTTP responses with status codes, headers, and bodies using an internal response type, facilitating dynamic server replies. Supports tasks such as parsing a GET request's path or generating a 200 OK response with a JSON body. Enables fine-grained control over incoming and outgoing HTTP traffic in web services.
